title: YelpCamp
description:
YelpCamp is a full-stack web application that allows users to explore, create, and review campgrounds across the United States. Built with Express.js and MongoDB, it implements full CRUD functionality, user authentication via Passport.js, and dynamic page rendering using EJS. Image uploads are handled through Cloudinary, creating a rich and interactive experience.

This project highlights backend development, RESTful API design, and deployment readiness.

title: Quizzy
description:
Quizzy is a single-page application (SPA) built with React and Vite that tests users on various subjects. It features a dynamic scoring system, a countdown timer for each question, and a progress bar for quiz tracking.

The app uses functional components and React hooks for state management, with a clean and responsive UI styled in plain CSS.

title: Traveler
description:
Traveler is a React-based travel log application built with TypeScript and Vite. It allows users to record cities and countries they've visited and view them in a clear, list-style layout.

Future updates will integrate an interactive map and global state management using the React Context API. This project reflects a focus on modular architecture and scalability.
